intro: Popowia letestui, commonly known as the Letestu's popowia, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with five petals and stamens. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
